definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Life creates itself in delirium and is undone in ennui.
sentences.chinese: 生命自创于狂乱，破灭于厌倦中。

sentences.english: He calls the proliferation of master's degrees evidence of “credentialing gone amok.
sentences.chinese: 他称硕士学位的泛滥迹象是“文凭获得走向狂乱。”

sentences.english: Too much of it may cause a man to go astray and lose himself in chimeras and illusions.
sentences.chinese: 过分隐逸使人走入歧途，迷失在狂乱幻觉中。

sentences.english: Sometime 'tis mad and too much talk affords.
sentences.chinese: 有时候又变为狂乱，滔滔地说个不停。

sentences.english: His own eyes shone with a maniacal fervour.
sentences.chinese: 他自己的眼睛闪烁着狂乱的激情。

sentences.english: A like fate awaits him and the two rages commingle in a whirlpool.
sentences.chinese: 同样的命运在等待着他，两种狂乱汇成一股漩涡。

sentences.english: You can see everything better after dusk, when the lunatic neon is switched on.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚当狂乱的霓虹灯打开，你就能看得更清楚了。

sentences.english: A state of violent mental agitation or wild excitement.
sentences.chinese: 狂乱一种狂烈的精神骚动或疯狂的状态。

sentences.english: Even though many times before, you never did escape the maddening abysm .
sentences.chinese: 尽管此前多次，你从未真正走出这狂乱的深渊。

definition: variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
